medium: Tiger maple and chestnut with painted rush seat
title: Side chair
text: The neoclassical design of this chair is loosely based on ancient Grecian Klismos (italics) chairs, yet the quatrefoil in the center of the middle slat suggests the influence of the Gothic revival style that gained popularity in America during the 1830s.  The front legs and splayed feet were formed through skillfully turning wood rods at two axis points.
description: Federal side chair with seat cushion; open carved rail
creditline: Given in memory of Belle and Abe Calmenson
